item.title: Oil Holds Gains Following China Stimulus
item.description: Oil prices were flattish in Europe but holding onto gains from the previous session that came after China took steps to stimulate its economy.

item.title: Dollar Rises After Earlier Losses as Traders Assess Fed Decision
item.description: The dollar edged higher in Europe after earlier hitting a five-week low as investors continued to digest Powell’s comments on future rate hikes, with upcoming decisions to depend on data, Commerzbank said.

item.title: China-Led Infrastructure Bank Just Can't Escape the Communist Party's Shadow
item.description: The Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank says it will conduct an internal review after former executive claims China’s Communist Party has infiltrated the institution.

item.title: 'Mines Everywhere': Ukraine's Offensive Is Proving a Hard Slog
item.description: After the first probing attacks yielded mixed results, Ukrainian forces have mostly paused their assaults as commanders try to figure out how to punch through Russian lines without taking huge losses.

item.title: Micron, Blacklisted by Beijing, to Pump $600 Million Into China Expansion
item.description: Investment by biggest U.S. maker of memory chips comes about a month after major Chinese firms were banned from buying its products.

item.title: Metals Tick Higher Amid Hopes of China Stimulus
item.description: Base metals and gold prices were ticking higher in London, with hopes of post-Covid stimulus being introduced in China helping to negate the current downturn in demand for industrial goods.

item.title: Pope Francis Released From Hospital After Operation for Hernia
item.description: The pontiff, 86, looked tired but cheerful as he greeted a gaggle of reporters outside a Rome hospital. “Still alive,” he said, when asked how he was.

item.title: Market Technicals Seen Driving Eurozone Bonds Near Term
item.description: The ECB signaled its intentions with bond reinvestments, leaving the eurozone government bond market to be moved by technicals, such as supply-demand balance, Citi said.

item.title: Tesco Backs Full-Year Views
item.description: Tesco said its like-for-like group retail sales grew 8.2% in the first quarter of fiscal 2024, boosted by volumes and inflation, and reiterated its guidance for the full year.

item.title: Disney CFO Clashed With Executives Before Stepping Down
item.description: Christine McCarthy’s exit caught some colleagues and associates by surprise.

item.title: China Infrastructure Stocks Rise, Buoyed by Report of Coming Stimulus
item.description: Hong Kong-listed infrastructure stocks rose after a report that Beijing is considering issuing $140 billion in special treasury bonds to finance infrastructure projects and other initiatives to boost economic growth.

item.title: Nasdaq CEO Adena Friedman Pursues a Black Belt in Dealmaking
item.description: She agreed to the largest deal in the company’s history. “I tend to take a competitive approach to life.”

item.title: Gas Prices Ease for Summer Driving Season
item.description: Americans are finding relief at the pump ahead of the busy driving season after prices hit records last year.

item.title: The Global Economy Looks Like It's Out of Sync
item.description: As the Federal Reserve and other central banks go in different directions, most capital markets remain linked to a common global force: the dollar.

item.title: The former first lady of the U.S. Virgin Islands helped Epstein's victims get visas and lined up English-language classes for them, facilitating his alleged sex-trafficking scheme, JPMorgan said in a court filing.
item.description: The former first lady of the U.S. Virgin Islands helped Epstein’s victims get visas and lined up English-language classes for them, facilitating his alleged sex-trafficking scheme, JPMorgan said in a court filing.

item.title: Several U.S. government agencies have been hacked in a data-stealing cyberattack exploiting a software bug that had already compromised major businesses in the U.K. and elsewhere, U.S. officials said.
item.description: Several U.S. government agencies have been hacked in a data-stealing cyberattack exploiting a software bug that had already compromised major businesses in the U.K. and elsewhere, U.S. officials said.

item.title: The ECB nudged up interest rates by a quarter percentage point and indicated it will continue to push them higher, with Lagarde saying that officials are unhappy with the outlook for inflation.
item.description: The ECB nudged up interest rates by a quarter percentage point and indicated it will continue to push them higher, with Lagarde saying that officials are unhappy with the outlook for inflation.

item.title: China is planning major steps to revive the country's flagging economy, including the possibility of billions of dollars in new infrastructure spending, people familiar with the discussions said.
item.description: China is planning major steps to revive the country’s flagging economy, including the possibility of billions of dollars in new infrastructure spending, people familiar with the discussions said.

item.title: The Biden administration announced commitments by Live Nation, its Ticketmaster unit and SeatGeek to make pricing more transparent on their ticket-buying platforms.
item.description: The Biden administration announced commitments by Live Nation, its Ticketmaster unit and SeatGeek to make pricing more transparent on their ticket-buying platforms.

item.title: The Fed and SEC are probing Goldman's role in buying Silicon Valley Bank's securities portfolio while it was working on a doomed capital raise before the bank's failure, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.description: The Fed and SEC are probing Goldman’s role in buying Silicon Valley Bank’s securities portfolio while it was working on a doomed capital raise before the bank’s failure, according to people familiar with the matter.
